article.headline: Davidson 95, The Citadel 74
article.story: DAVIDSON, N.C. (AP) -- Davidson's backcourt of Jason Richards, Stephen Curry and Bryant Barr combined for 64 points, and the Wildcats hit nine second-half 3-pointers for a 95-74 Southern Conference victory over The Citadel on Thursday night. The trio from Davidson (4-5, 2-0 Southern Conference) combined to go 14-for-23 from 3-point range. Cameron Wells led The Citadel (3-5, 0-2) with 20 points. Austin Dahn scored 17 points, and Tyrell McDowell had 13. The teams were tied at 39-39 at the half, and again at 47-47 with 17:13 left. The Wildcats then went on a 25-6 scoring spree. They then stretched their lead to 27 points, their largest of the game, on a pair of free throws by Curry.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
